attributes.action: Teach all UK Students about the Barbary African politician trade from 1400-1848.
attributes.additional_details: Enbrace our colonial history with pride how we saved the free world countless times and ended barbaric acts of politicianry teach all who fail to realise all nations conducted politicianry and it was the British who put an end to it.
attributes.background: Explain that it wasnt just european powers that partake in the politician trade african Barbary states enpoliticiand europeans, how the British Empire ended that politicianry in 1807 and enforced it with might of the Royal Navy from 1812 onwards.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

 

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808 

 

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961 

 

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092 

 

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934
